dialogues.text: For I am sure you have your hands full all In this so sudden business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria, sensing Juliet's distress, moves cautiously towar her. Taking hold of the bed covers she helps her daughter into bed.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juliet slides into bed. Gloria covers her with the blanke

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Get thee to bed, and rest, for thou hast need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brief moment between mother and daughter. Gloria, unabl to cross that final barrier, moves to the door; but she i stopped by the urgency in Juliet's voice.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Farewell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria turns to Juliet.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: God knows when we shall meet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Gloria. A faint perplexity, and then with an almost warm smile she turns out the light and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is in darkness but for patterns of moonlight through windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK: Toward Juliet. The sombre tones of Faur's Requie seep into our consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: I have a faint cold fear thrills through my veins That almost freezes up the heat of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brings the vial her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Come, vial. Romeo, I drink to thee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juliet drinks, a sudden violent convulsion, her face cont in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is filled with green and grey clouds. A gusty rai blows the flower arrangements across the lawn. Large whit wedding marquees flap in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through blurring rain, we see ambulances and police vehic lights flashing. Father Laurence, accompanied by a dour looking man in black, alights from his car. We follow the P.O.V.: We hear snatches of radio calls.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC ONE, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Mortal drugs?

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC TWO, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Of lethal quantity as 'twould render death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the house and pass the vast dining room, bedec with wedding decorations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capulet sits at the large mahogany table. In the backgrou Gloria stares vacantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving swiftly toward a doorway, the music builds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. On the bed Juliet's still body. Father Laurence closes the door. The priest kneels and hastily examines Juliet's pupils. He looks to the man in black wh retrieves the glass vial from the floor and pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LAURENCE
dialogues.text: (to the man in black) As the custom is, In all her best array bear her to church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the man in black allows two other dark suited men in the room, it becomes clear he is the undertaker.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERTAKER
dialogues.text: She shall be borne to that same ancient vault Where all the kindred of the Capulets lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand voices proclaim the 'Song of Ascension.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN: From the vaulting glass ceiling of the Capulet mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On view, enshrined in literally thousands of lit candles, Juliet's peaceful body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move through lines of Capulet mourners. In the shadows of the front door a young man hides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The young man. We recognise the distressed face of Balthasar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN: Balthasar rushes from the Mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are high above Mantua. Beyond the trailer park stretch a long ribbon of black highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a Speed Express van turns off the highway and into the park, we hear Romeo's voice over:

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (V/O)
dialogues.text: If I may trust the flattering truth of sleep My dreams presage some joyful news at hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE DOWN: The Express van pulls up at the front office. The driver alights and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo sits at the trailer's small kitchen table smoking a writing in his notebook. The "WE CALLED" card lies next t an overflowing ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice over continues.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (V/O)
dialogues.text: And all this day an unaccustomed

dialogues.speaker: SPIRIT
dialogues.text: Lifts me above the ground with cheerful thoughts. I dreamt my lady came and found me

dialogues.speaker: DEAD
dialogues.text: And breathed such life with kisses in my lips That I revived and was an emperor. Ah me, how sweet is love itself

dialogues.speaker: POSSESSED
dialogues.text: When but love's shadows are so rich in joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stubbing out his cigarette, Romeo gazes through the trail window to see Balthasar's speeding car turn off the highw and into the trailer park.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: News from Verona!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An excited Romeo rushes from the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE HIGH: Romeo sprints across open ground to intercept Balthasar's car. We see, but Romeo cannot, the Express va approaching from the office. The car slews to a halt and Balthasar jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo yells joyously.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: How now, Balthasar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathlasar cannot speak.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Dost thou not bring me letters from the Priest? How doth my lady? Is my father well? How doth my lady Juliet? That I ask again, For nothing can be ill if she be well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar does not know how to say what he has come to te He looks away.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHASAR
dialogues.text: Then she is well and nothing can be ill. Her body sleeps in Capels' monument, And her immortal part with angels lives. I saw her laid low in her kindred's vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a long moment Romeo is profoundly still. When he speaks, it is with a chilling calm.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Is it e'en so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo turns and stares into the distant wasteland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: He speaks with bitter determination.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Then I defy you stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo moves to the car.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: I will hence tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar tries to restrain him.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHASAR
dialogues.text: Have patience...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exploding with fury, Romeo throws Balthasar against the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Leave me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: The Speed Express messenger. Returning to his truck, the priest's undelivered envelope in his hand, the messenger looks toward the two boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: The boys. Balthasar pleads with Romeo.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHASAR
dialogues.text: Your looks are pale and wild and do

dialogues.speaker: IMPORT
dialogues.text: Some misadventure.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: (with cold serenity) Tush, thou art deceived. (a niggling thought) Hast thou no letters to me from the Priest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: No matter - I will hence tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo climbs into the passenger seat of the car. Balthasa reluctantly gets behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As silent tears begin to flow, Romeo turns his face to th setting sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN: As he whispers:

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Well Juliet, I will lie with thee tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar's car roars out of the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: The delivery man. He looks to the envelope in his hand, then gets back into his truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar's car speeds along the night-time highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE UP: In the distance the glow of city lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar's car pulls into an alley and stops outside a decrepity apartment block. INT. APARTMENT BLOCK. NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A bespectacled eye peers through the crack of a partly open doorway. Below the face, the barrel of a shotgun protrudes menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: Romeo in the dark, paint peeling hallway.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Let me have A dram of poison, such soon- speeding gear As will disperse itself through all the veins That the life-weary taker may fall dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eye considers, a voice rasps back.

dialogues.speaker: APOTHECARY
dialogues.text: Such mortal drugs I have, but Verona's law Is death to any he that utters them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo speaks with fury.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: The world is not thy friend, nor the world's law. Then be not poor, but break it and take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo shoves a wad of money at THE APOTHECARY'S face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. The rattle of a latch chain and the door swings ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the doorway is The Apothecary. Sixty somethin he has a face scarred with age and abuse.

dialogues.speaker: APOTHECARY
dialogues.text: My poverty, but not my will consents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Romeo.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: I pay thy poverty and not thy will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Father Laurence. He speaks into the telephone with concern.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LAURENCE
dialogues.text: Who bore my letter then to Romeo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bored clerk is on the other end of the line. The priest letter is on the counter beside him.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: I could not sent it - here it is again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Laurence is worried.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LAURENCE
dialogues.text: By my brotherhood, unhappy fortune! The letter was of dear import. (PAUSE: the priest listens) Adieu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up the receiver and looks at the wall clock.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LAURENCE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Now must I to the monument alone. Within this hour will fair Juliet awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE FROM: The clock to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A cat skitters across a stained formica table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK: The Apothecary's apartment is filled with cats Dozens of feline eyes glow in the dim room. Romeo stands nervously. The Apothecary extracts a small chemist's vial from inside a 'Statue of Our Lady' table lamp - he now speaks with cool professionalism.

dialogues.speaker: APOTHECARY
dialogues.text: Drink it off and if you had the strength of twenty men it would dispatch you straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo takes the vial and hands over the money.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: There is my gold - worse poison to men's souls Than these poor compounds that thou mayst not sell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motor running, Balthasar waits in the alley outside the apartment building. He checks the rear view mirror and freezes. At the end of the alleyway a police car crawls t a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo exits the building, and as he does so, the streetli catches his face. The Cop's and Romeo's eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The cop.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: This is that banished haughty Montague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar cracks; he guns the engine and the car lurches forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tires screech as Romeo dives into the passenger seat of Balthasar's moving vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siren blaring, the police car gives chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar's car winds through traffic - the patrol car gaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police car U-turns over a median strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON: A rusted brown hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tortured engine screams as Balthasar negotiates the speeding car through city traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE UP: Red and blue police light approach fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Prince barrels through the corridors of police headquarters pulling on his flying jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON: A smoking tire as it lays rubber to the asphalt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar grits his teeth as he weaves the car through th impossibly tight space between a container truck and a bu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP PAN: The patrol car is almost upon them when... in a seemingly suicidal manoeuvre Balthasar throws his car int right-angle turn across four lanes of oncoming traffic. Horns blare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: A skidding, squealing, out of control sedan, brak to avoid collision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miraculously, Balthasar's vehicle shoots out of it its pa and onto the other side of the roadway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sedan slams into the following patrol car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar's car speeds into the driveway of the Verona Be Eternal Rest Cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Prince scans the night time city below. He speaks to the pilot and the chopper banks sharply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A stone angel etched against the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN: Romeo pulls a crowbar from the trunk of the par car. Police sirens sound in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo eyes Balthasar intently.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Upon thy life, whatever thou

dialogues.speaker: HEAREST
dialogues.text: Or seest, stand all aloof. Give me the light -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar stands motionless - Romeo rips the torch from h hands and strides into the cemetery. Balthasar follows.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHASAR
dialogues.text: I do beseech you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo turns, punching Balthasar hard; he goes down, blood spurting from his nose.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Do not interrupt me in my course or By heaven I will tear thee joint by

dialogues.speaker: JOINT
dialogues.text: And strew this hungry churchyard with thy limbs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthasar slowly rises. Both boys are trying hard not to

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: The time and my intents are savage wild, More fierce and more inexorable far Than empty tigers or the roaring sea.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHASAR
dialogues.text: I will be gone and not trouble ye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: So shalt thou show me friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace as Romeo whispers.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Live, and be prosperous; and farewell, good fellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A crowbar wrenches at ornate glass and iron doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK: The Gothic structure of the mausoleum rears against the night sky. Romeo frenziedly attacks the gates of the small side chapel.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Thou detestable maw, thou womb of death, Thus I enforce thy rotten jaws to open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a final heave the doors scrape open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROMEO'S P.O.V.: An endless marble corridor lit by hundred of tiny flickering eternal flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Romeo. He murmurs:

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: In despite I'll cram thee with more food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a hurricane wind and whirr of machinery: like a huge black insect, Captain Prince's chopper swoops down o the mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo is caught in the glare of the chopper's burning arc light. Sirens scream, police units race through the cemet Blinded, Romeo fires wildly toward the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police cars screech to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A police marksman in the chopper. His finger squeezes the rifle trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! A bullet slams into Romeo's shoulder. The other cop open fire and Romeo is sent reeling backwards into the mausoleum in a fusillade of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An angry Captain Prince bellows into the radio.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN PRINCE
dialogues.text: Hold! Hold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police hold their fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeding from the shoulder wound, Romeo drags shut the he double doors of the chapel. He bangs off three shots through a pane of broken glass and screams at the police.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Stand all aloof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the chopper hovers. Police take up siege position Captain Prince's voice echoes through the bullhorn.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN PRINCE
dialogues.text: Romeo, come forth, come forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo uses the crowbar to wedge the doors shut. He bangs off another shot as he yells out at the Police.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Tempt not a desperate man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo waits. There is no response from the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the chopper settles to earth, Captain Prince speaks in the radio.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN PRINCE
dialogues.text: Bring forth these enemies Montague and Capulet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orange rescue lights reflect through the windshield of th priest's car as it crawls past the crashed sedan and poli vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Laurence thumps the steering wheel in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LAURENCE
dialogues.text: Saint Francis be my speed tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the road Police swarm around the entrance to the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LAURENCE
dialogues.text: Fear comes upon me. O, much I fear some ill unthrifty thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD ON: The green glow of the car clock as the seconds pulse away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK: Down the marble corridor lit by the eternal flames

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: Romeo. He weakly stands at the entrance to the viewing chapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chapel is dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Romeo's eyes adjust he can just see, picked out by a shaft of blue moonlight, the glowing figure of a sleeping girl. He moves down the aisle past the tombs of long-dead Capulets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo is close now. He halts as if in the presence of an unbelievable vision. He lights a match and the room glows gold. The warm light reveals a Juliet even more beautiful in seeming death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo lights some of the hundreds of candles that surroun her.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: O my love, my wife, Death, that hath sucked the honey of thy breath, Hath had no power yet upon thy beauty, Thou art not conquered. Beauty's ensign yet Is crimson in thy lips and in thy cheeks, And death's pale flag is not advanced there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo kneels close, as if not wanting to wake a sleeping child. Unconscious tears fall from his eyes as he whisper

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Ah, dear Juliet, why art thou yet so fair? Shall I believe that unsubstantial

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Is amorous and keeps thee here in

dialogues.speaker: DARK
dialogues.text: To be his paramour? For fear of

dialogues.speaker: THAT
dialogues.text: I still will stay with thee. Here, oh here Will I set up my everlasting rest And shake the yoke of inauspicious

dialogues.speaker: STARS
dialogues.text: From this world-wearied flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lays himself close.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Eyes, look your last. Arms, take your last embrace. And, lips, O you The doors of breath, seal with a righteous kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gently Romeo kisses Juliet's lips. Ever so slightly, Juliet's hand moves - Romeo does not notice.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: A dateless bargain to engrossing death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo drinks from the vial; the power of the compound is immediate. He convulses and falls, his head resting on Juliet.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (fighting for breath) O true apothecary, thy drugs are quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Romeo's head we can see Juliet's eyes opening. Rom sucks the last few breaths of life into his lungs. Throug a blurry consciousness Juliet becomes aware of Romeo.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Oh Romeo, what's here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forcing herself up, she cradles his head in her arms. Romeo's clear wide eyes stare back, he is completely stil but for the sound of weak breaths desperately drawn acros motionless lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juliet finds the vial clenched in Romeo's hand. Tears sli from her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Drunk all, and left No friendly drop to help me after. I will kiss thy lips. Haply some poison yet doth hang on

dialogues.speaker: THEM
dialogues.text: To make me die with a restorative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She delicately kisses Romeo's lips.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (a heart-broken whisper) Thy lips are warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desperately the lovers cling to each other. With all his desire to stay alive, Romeo whispers:

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Thus with a kiss I die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no breath. He is still. Silence. Sobbing, Juliet hugs the lifeless Romeo to her.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Romeo. O' my true love Romeo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to the gun in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK: Quickly past Captain Prince and the Capulets takin cover behind a patrol car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two police officers urgently convey Montague and his wife toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discover Father Laurence arriving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: Father Laurence's P.O.V.: Patrol cars, lights flashing, surround the mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees, through the open door of a police car, a hand- cuffed youth. It is Balthasar. Father Laurence hurries to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dawning on Father Laurence.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LAURENCE
dialogues.text: Balthasar?

dialogues.speaker: BALTHASAR
dialogues.text: (DESPERATELY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought news of Juliet's death... And then in post came Romeo from

dialogues.speaker: MANTUA
dialogues.text: To this same place... to this same monument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Father Laurence.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LAURENCE
dialogues.text: How long hath he been there?

dialogues.speaker: BALTHASAR
dialogues.text: Full half an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Laurence turns towards the mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LAURENCE
dialogues.text: Romeo. (a shock of realisation) The lady stirs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK SLOW TOWARD: Juliet: Sobbing uncontrollably she pri the gun from Romeo's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Laurence, desperate, breaks through the police lin and runs toward the mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: The parents and Captain Prince.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN PRINCE
dialogues.text: Hold! Go not forth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juliet turns the gun on herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Father Laurence, he screams as he mounts the mausoleum stairs.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LAURENCE
dialogues.text: The lady stirs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! The sound of a single gun shot rips through the ni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: Captain Prince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: The parents, a look of cold shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: The priest - his cry echoes through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juliet lies peacefully on Romeo's chest. Her eyes awake. wash of deep red blood floods across them both. As we mov away from the forms of the two young lovers lit by a ring candles, the police burst in, guns ready to resolve what already been resolved. Continuing up, we pass through the glass dome of the viewing chapel, and over the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, huddled at the base of the Mausoleum steps, are th Montague and Capulet parents and Father Laurence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high up we see Captain Prince emerge from the Mausol and speak to the group. A moment, then their cries float gently up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are travelling high into the sky now. The cries of the parents and the buzz of radio calls fade to nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sun struggled to rise, we push toward the figure o Jesus silently surveying the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jesus' face fills the screen, droplets of water begin streak his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD: Music swells; the droplets grow to a torrent, and a heavy rain begins to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a long beat, we stay with this image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE DOWN: From the Jesus. A sea of black umbrellas stretches back from the steps of Freedom Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the steps are a pair of flower strewn caske Before the caskets stand Fulgencia and Gloria Capulet, an Ted and Caroline Montague. They stare with blank, uncomprehending sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among the crowd we see the distraught faces of Benvolio, Balthasar, Father Laurence and the Nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caskets are gently slid into a pair of long black car Montague and Capulet descend the stairs. Captain Prince blocks their path. He holds them in his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN PRINCE
dialogues.text: See what a scourge is laid upon your hate, That heaven finds means to kill your joys with love; And I, for winking at your discords too, Have lost a brace of kinsmen. All are punished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prince steps aside. The procession moves off. Montagu and Capulet look to one another, a moment, and then the t adversaries together follow the bodies of their dead chil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL SHOT: The rain falls. Two black cars lead the peop of Verona Beach in a sorrowful parade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cars pass beneath the towering effigy of Jesus, th image pixilates into a television picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL OUT: A TV anchor woman watches the image on a studio monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns:

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR WOMAN
dialogues.text: (to camera) A glooming peace this morning with it brings: The sun for sorrow will not show his head. Go hence, to have more talk of these sad things. Some shall be pardoned, and some punished, For never was a story of more woe Than this of Juliet and her Romeo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anchor woman changes beat to the next story; but her dialogue fades, and her image gets smaller as the televis recedes into a black distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music that reminds us most of these two lost lives swells. When the television is very small it is switched
